item.title: [DISTRELEC-2628] Webtrekk Tracking for Carpet/Hero Teaser Extended
item.description:
folgendes ist vorgesehen: [country].[channel].[component]-[imageName].[language].[site]

  • [component] und [site]: Hier müssten Abkürzungen zum Einsatz kommen (Lookup-File --> müsste für marketing zugänglich sein) um die ID-Länge beschränken zu können.
  • ID-Abschluss mit '-': Bitte um folgende Ergänzung: [country].[channel].[component]-[imageName].[language].[site].-

Die Id wird automatisch generiert.
item.summary: Webtrekk Tracking for Carpet/Hero Teaser Extended

comments.comment:
Ich hätte dazu eine kleine formale Zusatzanforderung:

Betrifft die [component]-Abkürzungen (vgl. weiter unten). Ich wäre auf Syntax-Logik angewiesen:

[component]-Wert enthält drei Buchstaben und beginnt immer mit einem 'z'. Beispiel [component]-Wert für ein Carpet-Element: zct (wobei 'ct' für die Komponente, in diesem Fall
'Carpet', steht).

...

Beispiel Carpet image name (im .ch-Webshop [de] auf der Homepage): Applediscountcampaign-1343.jpg

--> Generated ID: ch.ons.zct-applediscountcampaign-1343.de.ho
Pascal, please coordinate with Dominic the implementation of this together with the bug fixes assigned yesterday by Nando.
Please confirm that this is only required for CH/IT Release

Hi Dominic,

can you please take care of this Change Request. Your high priority are bugs from AT. Work only on this tasks if you completed the tasks of release AT.

Can you please give me an estimation as well.

Thank you.

Hi Dominic,

A short additional feedback from my side in terms of the [site]-element (as previously shortly discussed with you on the phone, I have clarified that with Florian): This Change Request is explicitly not referring only to the Homepage ('ho'). It is to apply wherever a teaser-element can be forced within a carpet/hero element (e.g. any CMS-page / partially also Catalogue-pages --> to be clarified by Namics). In case of any page (excluding the Homepage) the according Page-ID shall be tranmitted as part of ID ([site]-element).

Bests, Mark
I changed the priority from mayor to minor as this is required for the CH release, see comments.
As discussed with Patrick Frei I'll change the priority to critical because it is required for the CH roll out.
I assume this must be done only for teasers inside a carpet (and not products inside a carpet) and for all hero teasers (there is no hero teaser extended). Is this correct?

Hi Dominic
- Point 1 is correct. It only must be done for the manually created banners.
- Point 2 is not correct. There is also a hero teaser extended including manually created banners.

- Point 2: There is only one Teaser Component, but it may contain different types of items (products, teasers, categories and manufacturers). I assume this Ticket should only affect "teasers".

I talk to Husi about the two new fields [component] and [site].

Hi Dominic

I think we do not realy need additional fields for that. I think for the component we can take the ID of the component and the site, if I had read it correctly, should contain the current site. If yes this is a session value that is already present. So we just have to add the information to the model and you can include that.
At the moment I'm on holiday but I think you will find somebody else that can shortly include this information into the model.

Greez
Raphael
